doc.headline: Three US passengers on crashed Indonesian plane

text.p: Three Americans were among the 102 passengers and crew on board an Adam Air plane which crashed into a remote mountainous region of Indonesia, an airline official said Tuesday.
"There are three foreign citizens, all American from one family," Adam Air spokesman Ali told AFP.
"Their names are: Scott Jackson and his two daughters Stephanie and Lindsay."
The Adam Air Boeing 737-400 crashed Monday after vanishing off air traffic control radar screens between the Indonesian islands of Java and Sulawesi.
Up to 12 people were thought to have survived, with rescue teams racing to the crash site near Polewali in West Sulawesi, some 180 kilometres north of the South Sulawesi provincial capital Makassar.
It was not immediately known whether the Americans were among the survivors.
